topics.body:
Good things this year:
First 3D printed food and theoretically this could end world hunger in two decades.
Computers are taking over more and more of the stock market theoretically making the probability of another crash considerably smaller and smaller the more and more they are in charge.
3D printed organs that might in a decade save countless lives.
Artificial blood being worked in a decade save countless lives.
Massive advancements in prosthetics for people.
Solar roadways in experimental development phase which would drastically reduce global warming.
Algae biofuel becoming increasingly cheaper and cheaper which could not only end global warming but reverse it.
The total number of states in the usa where gay marriage is legal is 35 and covers 64% of the usa's population and there's a overwhelming probability that gay marriage will be legal in all but five states by 2016.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547c1cac63687202ecac0100#post_547c1cac63687202ecac0100
Keep in mind the technology costs a lot right now, but that the technology a decade ago cost millions of dollars.  I'd have to take a completely blind shot in the dark, but I'd have to say 2020 to 2025 because keep in mind right now it's still expensive and that a lot of people buy used cars instead.  As time goes on it'll get exponentially cheaper and as a result more and more people will have cars that can drive themselves, but right now it's out of the realm of the average consumer in much the same way ten years ago large flatscreen plasma tvs were but now a flatscreen plasma tv costs only a couple hundred dollars instead.
